Public getter is legacy and will be removed in the future. Use `otherBridge` instead."},"bridgeERC721(address,address,uint256,uint32,bytes)":{"notice":"Initiates a bridge of an NFT to the caller's account on the other chain. Note that         this function can only be called by EOAs. Smart contract wallets should use the         `bridgeERC721To` function after ensuring that the recipient address on the remote         chain exists. Also note that the current owner of the token on this chain must         approve this contract to operate the NFT before it can be bridged.         **WARNING**: Do not bridge an ERC721 that was originally deployed on Optimism. This         bridge only supports ERC721s originally deployed on Ethereum. Users will need to         wait for the one-week challenge period to elapse before their Optimism-native NFT         can be refunded on L2."},"bridgeERC721To(address,address,address,uint256,uint32,bytes)":{"notice":"Initiates a bridge of an NFT to some recipient's account on the other chain. Note         that the current owner of the token on this chain must approve this contract to         operate the NFT before it can be bridged.         **WARNING**: Do not bridge an ERC721 that was originally deployed on Optimism. This         bridge only supports ERC721s originally deployed on Ethereum. Users will need to         wait for the one-week challenge period to elapse before their Optimism-native NFT         can be refunded on L2."},"messenger()":{"notice":"Messenger contract on this domain."},"otherBridge()":{"notice":"Contract of the bridge on the other network."},"paused()":{"notice":"This function should return true if the contract is paused.         On L1 this function will check the SuperchainConfig for its paused status.         On L2 this function should be a no-op."}},"notice":"ERC721Bridge is a base contract for the L1 and L2 ERC721 1f41a831ec39d47002e73ecc2aa3e6624f8d1ab7b9f25b53348e8b0765df","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://2162fa7529a77b199a07f37fca26c778542f6c8805f0365f1ceef90c5cd3a3a7","dweb:/ipfs/QmaMmHJS52Bp95AGnrjh1zV7fLLqV3uAbFzkVLziMnPJYa"]},"src/universal/StandardBridge.sol":{"keccak256":"0xa3755ba03080d3c01c905c0d4d4d9b5105982c3553e7bc512a9df7a9754754a1","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://218aad18881bfeef187c2cdc132036976310f785b55dc63d7df9034aaff536c5","dweb:/ipfs/QmSDRyWV8nD99Nwp12zMvM4iKRqd7f4sNgkzXYHx7V79Ep"]}},"version":1}

returns._0: Contract of the bridge on the other network.

params._extraData: Optional data to forward to the other chain. Data supplied here will not                     be used to execute any code on the other chain and is only emitted as                     extra data for the convenience of off-chain tooling.
params._localToken: Address of the ERC721 on this domain.
params._minGasLimit: Minimum gas limit for the bridge message on the other domain.
params._remoteToken: Address of the ERC721 on the remote domain.

params._extraData: Optional data to forward to the other chain. Data supplied here will not                     be used to execute any code on the other chain and is only emitted as                     extra data for the convenience of off-chain tooling.
params._localToken: Address of the ERC721 on this domain.
params._minGasLimit: Minimum gas limit for the bridge message on the other domain.
params._remoteToken: Address of the ERC721 on the remote domain.
params._to: Address to receive the token on the other domain.

returns._0: Whether or not the contract is paused.

MESSENGER().notice: Legacy getter for messenger contract.         Public getter is legacy and will be removed in the future. Use `messenger` instead.

OTHER_BRIDGE().notice: Legacy getter for other bridge address.         Public getter is legacy and will be removed in the future. Use `otherBridge` instead.

bridgeERC721(address,address,uint256,uin.notice: Initiates a bridge of an NFT to the caller's account on the other chain. Note that         this function can only be called by EOAs. Smart contract wallets should use the         `bridgeERC721To` function after ensuring that the recipient address on the remote         chain exists. Also note that the current owner of the token on this chain must         approve this contract to operate the NFT before it can be bridged.         **WARNING**: Do not bridge an ERC721 that was originally deployed on Optimism. This         bridge only supports ERC721s originally deployed on Ethereum. Users will need to         wait for the one-week challenge period to elapse before their Optimism-native NFT         can be refunded on L2.

bridgeERC721To(address,address,address,u.notice: Initiates a bridge of an NFT to some recipient's account on the other chain. Note         that the current owner of the token on this chain must approve this contract to         operate the NFT before it can be bridged.         **WARNING**: Do not bridge an ERC721 that was originally deployed on Optimism. This         bridge only supports ERC721s originally deployed on Ethereum. Users will need to         wait for the one-week challenge period to elapse before their Optimism-native NFT         can be refunded on L2.

otherBridge().notice: Contract of the bridge on the other network.

paused().notice: This function should return true if the contract is paused.         On L1 this function will check the SuperchainConfig for its paused status.         On L2 this function should be a no-op.

MESSENGER().notice: Legacy getter for messenger contract.         Public getter is legacy and will be removed in the future. Use `messenger` instead.

OTHER_BRIDGE().notice: Legacy getter for other bridge address.         Public getter is legacy and will be removed in the future. Use `otherBridge` instead.

bridgeERC721(address,address,uint256,uin.notice: Initiates a bridge of an NFT to the caller's account on the other chain. Note that         this function can only be called by EOAs. Smart contract wallets should use the         `bridgeERC721To` function after ensuring that the recipient address on the remote         chain exists. Also note that the current owner of the token on this chain must         approve this contract to operate the NFT before it can be bridged.         **WARNING**: Do not bridge an ERC721 that was originally deployed on Optimism. This         bridge only supports ERC721s originally deployed on Ethereum. Users will need to         wait for the one-week challenge period to elapse before their Optimism-native NFT         can be refunded on L2.

bridgeERC721To(address,address,address,u.notice: Initiates a bridge of an NFT to some recipient's account on the other chain. Note         that the current owner of the token on this chain must approve this contract to         operate the NFT before it can be bridged.         **WARNING**: Do not bridge an ERC721 that was originally deployed on Optimism. This         bridge only supports ERC721s originally deployed on Ethereum. Users will need to         wait for the one-week challenge period to elapse before their Optimism-native NFT         can be refunded on L2.

otherBridge().notice: Contract of the bridge on the other network.

paused().notice: This function should return true if the contract is paused.         On L1 this function will check the SuperchainConfig for its paused status.         On L2 this function should be a no-op.

ERC721BridgeFinalized(address,address,ad.notice: Emitted when an ERC721 bridge from the other network is finalized.

ERC721BridgeInitiated(address,address,ad.notice: Emitted when an ERC721 bridge to the other network is initiated.

userdoc.notice: ERC721Bridge is a base contract for the L1 and L2 ERC721 bridges.

returns._0: Contract of the bridge on the other network.

params._extraData: Optional data to forward to the other chain. Data supplied here will not                     be used to execute any code on the other chain and is only emitted as                     extra data for the convenience of off-chain tooling.
params._localToken: Address of the ERC721 on this domain.
params._minGasLimit: Minimum gas limit for the bridge message on the other domain.
params._remoteToken: Address of the ERC721 on the remote domain.

params._extraData: Optional data to forward to the other chain. Data supplied here will not                     be used to execute any code on the other chain and is only emitted as                     extra data for the convenience of off-chain tooling.
params._localToken: Address of the ERC721 on this domain.
params._minGasLimit: Minimum gas limit for the bridge message on the other domain.
params._remoteToken: Address of the ERC721 on the remote domain.
params._to: Address to receive the token on the other domain.

returns._0: Whether or not the contract is paused.

params.extraData: Extra data for use on the client-side.
params.localToken: Address of the token on this domain.
params.remoteToken: Address of the token on the remote domain.
params.tokenId: ID of the specific token deposited.
